definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: In the household, young kids are imbued with concept of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭中，孩子從小就被灌輸自立自強的觀念。

sentences.english: I have learnt to be more independent and self-reliant.
sentences.chinese: 我學會更加獨立與自立自強。

sentences.english: Nowadays, aged man is really preferred to choose those free-standing self-improvement women.
sentences.chinese: 這個年代，男人真正比較喜歡是那些自立自強的女人。

definition: independent and autonomous (idiom); self-determination/to act independently/to maintain control over one's own affairs
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
(said of sb else's wife) a good wife
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
to carry on one's ancestral line
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
